newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL shares end flat, despite foreign buying.
newsitem.headline: KL shares end flat, despite foreign buying.

text.p: Malaysian shares closed almost unchanged on Friday, even though some foreign institutions began showing interest in selected blue-chip stocks, analysts said.
The benchmark Composite Index closed 0.23 of a point higher at 1,107.37 on a lack of local buying interest, dealers said.
"There has been selling of stale long positions, but on the whole it has generally been totally unexciting today," said Tony Shue, an institutional dealer at Jupiter Securities.
"There has been some interest in better quality stocks. We have had requests from some dealers in London for gaming stocks," said Fiona Leong, head of research at JM Sassoon.
News of Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad's two-month sabbatical was a reflection of his confidence in his grip on power locally, analysts said.
Volume remained thin, with 226 million shares traded valued at 1.633 billion ringgit. -- Azhar Sukri (603 206 2323)
